content: उपास् {c2c} <ab>A.</ab> {@--1@} To sit near to (with <ab>acc.</ab>), sit at the side of (as a mark of submission and respect); wait upon, serve, worship; उद्यानपालसामान्यमृतवस्तमुपासते <ls>Ku. 2. 36</ls>; अंबामुपास्स्व सदयां <ls>Aśvad. 13</ls>; <ls>Śi. 16. 47</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 189.</ls> {@--2@} To use, occupy, abide in, reside; <ls>Ms. 5. 93.</ls> {@--3@} To pass (as time); उपास्य रात्रिशेषं तु <ls>Rām.</ls> {@--4@} To approach, go to or towards; उपासांचक्रिरे द्रष्टुं देवगंधर्वकिन्नराः <ls>Bk. 5. 107</ls>; परलोकमुपास्महे <ls n="Bk.">7. 89.</ls> {@--5@} To invest or blockade (as an enemy's town). {@--6@} To be intent upon, be engaged in, take part in, (perform as a sacred rite); उपास्य पश्चिमां संध्यां <ls>K. 176</ls>, <ls n="K.">179</ls>; तेप्युपासंतु मे मखं <ls>Mb.</ls>; <ls>Ms. 2. 222</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">3. 104</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">7. 223</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">11. 42.</ls> {@--7@} To undergo, suffer; अलं ते पांडुपुत्राणां भक्त्या क्लंशमुपासितुं <ls>Mb.</ls>; <ls>Ms. 11. 184.</ls> {@--8@} To remain or continue in any state or action; <ab>oft.</ab> with a {%<ab>pres. p.</ab>%}; <ls>Bg. 12. 6.</ls> {@--9@} To expect, wait for; दिष्टमुपासीनः <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--10@} To attach oneself to, practise; <ls>Y. 3. 192.</ls> {@--11@} To resort to, employ, apply, use; लक्षणोपास्यते यस्य कृते <ls>S. D. 2</ls>; वस्तिरुपास्यमानः <ls>Suśr.</ls> {@--12@} To respect, recognize, acknowledge. {@--13@} To practise archery.
